title: German mayor takes 'time out' after using racist slur
description: The mayor of Germany’s southwestern city of Tuebingen said Monday that he’s taking some “time out” after coming under fire for using a racist slur at a conference

title: 85% of Mexican union contracts weren't voted on by workers
description: Mexico’s Labor Department says 85% of the country’s 140,000 officially registered labor contracts are in danger of being canceled because they failed to meet Monday’s deadline to have union members vote on them

title: Canada contract accord ends strike for most public workers
description: The Canadian government has reached a tentative contract agreement with its largest workers union, ending a 12-day strike by more than 120,000 public servants

title: Bolivia to investigate late Spanish priest accused of abuse
description: Bolivia’s top prosecutor is investigating a late Spanish priest who allegedly abused several minors in Bolivia dating back to the 1980s

title: Toll rises from 103 to 110 in Kenya cult starvation deaths
description: Kenyan officials say the number of deaths linked to a cult in the area on the country’s Indian Ocean coast has risen to from 103 to 110

title: Bomb attack in Bulgaria targets chief prosecutor’s car
description: Bulgaria’s chief prosecutor has escaped unharmed as a bomb exploded on a motorway near the capital, Sofia, while his motorcade drove past on Monday, government officials said

title: Palestinian boy mauled to death by lion in private Gaza zoo
description: A Palestinian boy was mauled to death by a lion in a private zoo in the Gaza Strip

title: Helpful hand? Activist glues palm to podium on live Swiss TV
description: An environmental activist stormed the set of a Swiss television debate on Sunday and glued himself to a podium while live on air, only to be extracted, heels dragging, a few minutes later

title: King Charles coronation guest list: Who is coming and who isn’t
description: The guests at Westminster Abbey will include fewer world leaders and a younger generation of royalty compared to the fall funeral of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Hundreds of thousands of French protest Macron reforms on May Day
description: Normally raucous May Day protests across France are expected to be even larger this year amid the public rage over President Macron's moves to raise the retirement age.

title: In photos: Workers rally around the world to mark May Day
description: People squeezed by inflation and demanding economic justice took to the streets of cities across Asia and Europe to mark May Day on Monday, in a global outpouring of worker discontent not seen since before the COVID-19 pandemic sent the world into lockdowns.

title: Tornado in Virginia Beach destroys homes, causes gas leaks
description: Officials are assessing tornado damage Monday after the storm moved through the City of Virginia Beach Sunday, damaging dozens of homes, downing trees and causing gas leaks

title: New dig likely buries hopes of unearthing Dutch WWII loot
description: An officially sanctioned hunt for a stash of precious jewelry looted by the Nazis during World War II and purportedly buried in a sleepy Dutch village has — like many previous searches — failed to unearth any treasure

title: McCarthy invites Netanyahu to visit Congress, skip the White House
description: On a trip to Israel, House Speaker Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) sought common cause with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu over frustrations with President Biden.

title: Al Jazeera says long-held correspondent released in Egypt
description: The satellite news network Al Jazeera says that a correspondent for one of its channels held in Egypt since 2019 has been released after nearly four years in pre-trial detention

title: UN envoy says Sudan's warring sides agree to negotiate
description: The United Nations’ top official in Sudan says the country’s warring generals have agreed to send representatives for negotiations, potentially in Saudi Arabia

title: Fraught U.S-Israel ties on display as Knesset reconvenes
description: Israeli lawmakers reconvene Monday after a month-long parliament recess, resuming the fight over a contentious government plan to overhaul the judiciary that has split Israelis and drawn concern from Israel’s most important ally, the United States

title: Regional talks on Syria's fate kick off in Jordanian capital
description: Regional leaders are meeting in Jordan to discuss Syria’s return to the Arab fold and a Jordanian proposal to reach a “political solution” to the Syrian conflict

title: Will Camilla be queen when Charles is crowned? All your questions answered.
description: Everything to know about her titles, her role and her relationship with King Charles III.

title: Virginia Beach struck by tornado, dozens of homes damaged
description: The City of Virginia Beach declared a state of emergency after a tornado moved through the area Sunday and damaged dozens of homes, downed trees and caused gas leaks

title: Name etched in gold, King Charles' school remembers him
description: King Charles III hasn’t even been crowned yet but his name is already etched on the walls of Hill House School in London

title: Paris exhibit celebrates 'first celebrity' Sarah Bernhardt
description: The pioneering and scandalous French stage star Sarah Bernhardt was one of the world’s most famous women by the time of her death in 1923

title: Erdogan says Turkish forces killed IS chief in Syria
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan says Turkish forces have killed the leader of the Islamic State group during an operation in Syria

title: UK's diverse communities ambivalent about king's coronation
description: Britain’s diverse communities will come together across London to mark King Charles III’s coronation

title: Palestinians: Israeli fire kills teen in West Bank raid
description: The Palestinian Health Ministry says Israeli forces have fatally shot a Palestinian teenager in a raid in the occupied West Bank

title: Case details Sinaloa cartel's fentanyl-fueled evolution
description: Prosecutors revealed in a recent indictment that while Sinaloa cartel boss Joaqu�n “El Chapo” Guzmán serves a life sentence, his sons have steered the family business into fentanyl, establishing a network of labs churning out massive quantities of the cheap, deadly drug that they smuggle into the U.S. The indictment unsealed April 14 in Manhattan details a generational shift

title: Eyeing China, Biden official floats a new ‘Washington consensus’
description: National security adviser Jake Sullivan last week delivered an address viewed as the clearest illustration yet of the Biden administration’s big picture view of the way forward on trade, the global economy and the dilemma of confronting China.
